body.name: RK ROYAL KLUDGE H81 Wireless Mechanical Keyboard, 75% Knob Control Triple Mode BT5.1/2.4Ghz/USB-C Gaming Keyboard Gasket Mount with RGB Backlit 3750mAH Battery Hot Swappable Brown Switch

byLineInfo.name: Visit the RK ROYAL KLUDGE Store

deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 17 hrs 11 mins
features: [Gasket Mounted Keyboards] - Elevate your typing experience with RK H81, which utilizes a high-quality gasket material to absorb vibrations and eliminate any unwanted noise. The gasket material creates a buffer between the keyboard plate and the case, providing exceptional stability and more precise keystrokes. Ideal for professionals who demand precision and comfort, gamers who need speed and accuracy.

[Knob controls Multi-device Connection] This tkl keyboard has three connection modes: USB-C wired, 2.4G wireless, and Bluetooth 5.1. It's suitable for those who need versatility and convenience in their daily routine. You can connect up to 5 devices and easily switch between them with the knob of the wireless mechanical keyboard. It's quick, seamless, and easy to use. Whether you're a professional or a casual user, this gaming keyboard wireless has it all.

[RK Brown Switch] The wireless mechanical keyboard uses a relatively soft and quiet brown switch, which does not make a strong sound when operating, and is suitable for use in offices or public places. The lightweight trigger design of the wireless gaming keyboard allows you to press keys easily and quickly, keeping your fingers comfortable while typing.

[3750mAh High-capacity Battery] - the wireless mechanical keyboard, powered by a high-capacity 3750mAh battery that can keep up for up to 7 days. This keyboard has double-layer inclined bottom frame ensures comfortable typing even without a wrist rest. with its hot-swap PCB, you can easily replace 3 pins/5 pins switches.

[RGB Backlit] With selection of 18 RGB Backlight Modes, 8 monochrome Backlight Modes, 1 full Color Backlight, 3 custom RGB Backlights, and a staggering 16 million colors to choose from on each individually backlit key. With Windows software, this 75% keyboard's RGB lighting and macro key settings can be adjusted according to your creativity
body.description: You better know these shortcuts about the H81 How to adjust the lighting effect through the keyboard? Fn + ↑ Backlight Brightness+ ; Fn + ↓ Backlight Brightness-Fn + → Backlight Speed+ ; Fn + ← Backlight Speed -Fn + " ,<" Switch the backlight color ; Fn + " \ |" Switch Backlight ModeFn + Space Restore to factory settings ; Fn + window Window lock MORE SHORTCUTS Fn + Del: ScrLK, Fn + Back Record Fn + PgUp: PrtSc, Fn + PgDn: Home Fn + "]}": End, Fn + Pause: Ins Fn + A: Switch to windows system, Fn + S: Switch to mac system

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: RK ROYAL KLUDGE H81 Tri-Mode Gasket Mechanical Keyboard RK ROYAL KLUDGE, with a decade of expertise, is a renowned manufacturer specializing in high-performance professional mechanical keyboards. Equipped with a professional engineering and technical team, as well as a dedicated R&D department, RK ROYAL KLUDGE ensures high-quality design and production. Our mission is to deliver top-notch craftsmanship, superior tactile feedback, and unmatched performance to the gaming community. We firmly believe that a mechanical keyboard should not only be functional and reliable but also customizable and visually appealing. We constantly strive to offer you the most fitting products. Introducing the RK ROYAL KLUDGE H81 Tri-Mode Gasket Mechanical Keyboard with classic appearance, featuring Brown Switch, Which is a popular mechanical keyboard switch type. It is cherished for its tactile feedback and smooth keystrokes. Whether you're a dedicated gamer seeking the ultimate gaming keyboard or a professional in need of a reliable and efficient typing experience, we have the perfect keyboard to meet your needs.
GASKET-MOUNTED DESIGN Utilizes a high-quality gasket material to absorb vibrations and eliminate any unwanted noise. Providing exceptional stability and more precise keystrokes.

Knob Control 5 Devices OFF: Wired connection to 1 deviceG: 2.4GHz connects 1 deviceB1/B2/B3: Connect 3 devices via Bluetooth H81 can connect up to 5 devices, such as your computer, laptop, mobile phone, iPad, etc. The connection between each device can be controlled through the knob, and switching between various usage scenarios is quick and convenient. It is a practical tool for your office and gaming.

RK ROYAL KLUDGE SOFTWARE All Keys Programmable. Set your own RGB lighting and macro key as you like.Driver Software Link: bit.ly/RKRGBSOFT(The programmer is only for Window system, pls run the software in wired mode) HOT SWAPPABLE KEYBOARD Hot-swappable PCB can realize the operation of replacing the switch at will, you can replace the switch without worrying about soldering and 3 or 5pin troubles

Convenient Shortcuts: Fn+F1: My ComputerFn+F2: BrowserFn+F3: Email, Fn+F4: CalculatorFn+F5: Music, Fn+F6: StopFn+F7: Previous, Fn+F8: Play/PauseFn+F9: Next, Fn+F10: MuteFn+F11: Volume-, Fn+F12: Volume+ You better know these shortcuts about the H81 How to adjust the lighting effect through the keyboard? Fn + ↑ Backlight Brightness+ ; Fn + ↓ Backlight Brightness-Fn + → Backlight Speed+ ; Fn + ← Backlight Speed -Fn + " ,<" Switch the backlight color ; Fn + " \ |" Switch Backlight ModeFn + Space Restore to factory settings ; Fn + window Window lock MORE SHORTCUTS Fn + Del: ScrLK, Fn + Back Record Fn + PgUp: PrtSc, Fn + PgDn: Home Fn + "]}": End, Fn + Pause: Ins Fn + A: Switch to windows system, Fn + S: Switch to mac system

POWER DISPLAY The pc gaming keyboard has equipped with a 3750mAh battery that can last up to 7 days of continuous use. Long press Fn+Enter to check the remaining power at any time, Get rid of power anxiety. USB-C HUB When the white mechanical keyboard is in the wired state, another interface can connect the mobile device and the computer for file transfer. 3 Indicator Lights Allows you to easily judge capitalization, win/mac mode, and scroll lock status. 3 ANGLE ADJUSTMENTS Double feet can provide 3 height options, there is always a height that suits you. The magnetic suction design on the back is convenient for you to store the dongle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really good for a starter keyboard
reviews.reviewText: Sounds and feels great stock, straight out of the box. Easy to mod, Fun to type on

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of best KB i've used, works and looks fantastic
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a good smaller compact gaming keyboard to replace a full size, wireless, chicklet keyboard. I kept looking a various brands, reading and watching reviews on many of them. I didn't want to spend over a specific amount, because the well known brands can be almost 2 to 3x's as much. I also know you get what you pay for so buying the cheaper, unknown brands you are kinda rolling the dice on support and durability. I'm super happy to have selected the Royal Kludge brand and this keyboard is just fantastic beyond my expectations. Battery life is mindblowing, and you can always use it while plugged into the USB-C cable while it charges. It's got a nice LED battery level indicator, and so many different LED modes, it's just insane at this price point. Feedback on the keys is great, way better than a membrane one that this replaced. It's nice to have 2.4Ghz and 3 Bluetooth options for this keyboard, I highly recommend this keyboard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Fantastic Keyboard at a Fantastic Price
reviews.reviewText: I'll just say right off the bat: in the relatively short amount of time that I've been diving into the mechanical keyboard hobby (half a year or so), I think this is the best keyboard I've used so far.Before buying the H81, I originally purchased Royal Kludge's RK61 (60%) model with the idea that I would be able to get used to not having dedicated delete, arrow, and F keys, which I realized after a while that I could not. I returned the RK61, though I was left with a very good impression, as it was the first RK board I'd ever purchased. I opted for the H81 as it's replacement, and I'm glad I did. It has done nothing but impress me thus far.First of all, the layout is perfect for me. It has the aforementioned keys I missed on the 60%, and omits all the other dedicated keys I never use (scroll lock, home, insert, etc...), though they can still be accessed through other keys + the FN key for people that want them. Both that and removing the number pad leaves it at a nice compact size of less than even a TKL keyboard. The case itself has a good heft to it, and while it is plastic, it still feels high quality. Also, though it's a preference thing, I love the fact that it has a thick bezel. I think thick bezels look a lot better than thin ones. The dust cover is also a nice touch.To be completely honest, knowing that the switches were Royal Kludge-branded, I was fully planning on replacing them with something else (the Royal Kludge switches on the RK61 I had were good, but could've been better), but as soon as I started typing I fell in love. They are completely free of scratchiness and sound absolutely heavenly thanks to them being pre-lubed. Usually factory-applied lube is not great, or at least not consistent, but in my opinion the Sky Cyan switches in this board feel and sound just as good as Gateron Yellow switches I hand-lubed. The description mentions that these switches are supposed to be like them, but I was skeptical. They definitely annihilated my expectations. The stabilizers are just as good. Buying boards in the past I've always had to re-lube the stabs, but I was pleasantly surprised that they sounded fantastic right out of the box, no rattling at all, and consistent across all of them. I am absolutely blown away at how nice this board sounds and feels at this price. It is buttery smooth and has a nice thocky sound profile. I'm sure the silicone in the bottom of the case also helps with that.Though I have replaced the keycaps that came on this board (as seen in my review photo), there is absolutely nothing wrong with the ones that come stock. They are good quality and they feel great, with the double-shot legends looking nice and sharp. I just had another set that I already planned on using before buying this board.Though I already have a keycap and switch puller, it is still nice that one is included for people that don't have one. It's also nice that a few extra switches are included.The only things I can't comment on are the bluetooth and dongle connections, I've only used it wired.Other boards that I've had in the past were good, but I always wanted something more. I think I've finally found a board that I'm completely satisfied with. I don't think you can find a better value in a keyboard for the price. Having had a Skyloong keyboard that sells for more than this one, I think the H81 is nicer. After hearing so much hype around the name Royal Kludge, and now after finally getting to try the H81 and (briefly) the RK61 out for myself, I can say I'm a fan. I'd say they definitely punch well above their respective price points. I typed out this review using this keyboard and it has been an absolute joy.Bottom line: I would definitely recommend this keyboard, especially if you want one that will sound and feel great right out of the box without having to do any modding.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good keyboard. Software dodgy and won't detect device.
reviews.reviewText: The keyboard sounds great. I do love the switches. I have no complaints on build quality at all although I haven't opened it up yet. For the price I paid and ease of use I'm extremely happy SO FAR. No issues gaming in wireless at all. Battery life seems fine you can use it while it charges so makes it even less a big deal.Now onto the software. I'm on windows 11 latest drivers on everything windows are as up to date as possible. The software installs fine. Just when it launches it says no device detected. NOW this could be because the PID listed for my keyboard is different than the required PID for the software. I don't know what this is about, and customer service hasn't responded yet. Also, the software does say there is an update but fails to download it. I am located in the US so that may be the issue.You don't need the software for the keyboard to work just making a note that it doesn't work. This would be bad if there was a firmware update or something that needed to be applied to the keyboard to fix something.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best keyboard I've ever owned
reviews.reviewText: The linear switches feel and sound excellent. This gasket structure is more about the sound rather than the feel. It absorbs vibration at the bottom, without softening the touch by too much. It still sounds fabulously clear like other top-notch TTC linear switches --- just with slightly reduced "volume" and less "bass", which is great if you care about your roommate/co-workers/significant other.The driver utility software is great. I can edit Fn layer and Fn2 layer easily, saving and loading the settings as .rkf files. This is on par with the high-end HHKB hybrid models that can cost $300+. For example, I don't need a numpad now, because I can map the numbers from 0 to 9 to Fn2 + B NM, HJK YUI. You can customize your own numpad. You edit it once and it will be saved to the board and used for wireless modes as well. Very cool.2.4Ghz connection is stable. I am not using it for competitive gaming so I can't comment in that regard. But it is much stabler than the iqunix l80 and cmk 87 from two years ago. I've owned several high-end models with 2-3x the price from cherry and filco. There is absolutely no comparison in terms of the typing experience and versatility. Worth every penny.

reviews.reviewTitle: First mechanical keyboard. I really like it!
reviews.reviewText: Coming from laptops and cheap $20 office keyboards, this reminds me of the old school keyboards I learned to type on in the early 2000s. I really enjoy the feel and sound. Much more satisfying typing experience than a laptop. I have noticed I'm hitting wrong keys more often, but I'm putting that down to I'm rusty with this style of keyboard. I have no idea what qualifies as "good" in the mechanical keyboard world; I just know I like this one.
Llego en el tiempo indicado, empacado, original y buena calidad

This was my first Mechanical keyboard and I reasearched a lot about the keyboard and what features that it should have and this one has all of it I was so amazed to see thatI work daily on it and I guess the battery is lasting for a month for me that is greatIt also have different patterns of light the looks really cool

reviews.reviewTitle: Gorgeous Hot Swappable Keyboard for Beginners
reviews.reviewText: - Nice weight to it, definitely doesn't feel cheaply made.- Switches are rather interesting, if you're fond of the standard keyboard typing sound but want it to be more muted and smoother (less clacky) if you get the drift.- Hot swapping: I can't comment on advanced modding personally (i.e. replacing switches, lubing) but swapping keycaps is a smooth experience. The keycaps it already comes with is satisfactory enough though. You don't need to worry about rough plastic edges or gritty surfaces.- Design is a must for anyone looking for a keyboard with a different look from the standard. (Retro aesthetics are personally a favourite for me). The keyboard ridge is a very light grey though, so keep that in mind if you are searching for an actual white keyboard. Personally I think it is still versatile and can compliment many other custom keycaps.- THE KNOB: this feature is one of the biggest highlight. Have to see how it holds up over time but for now I can see it being useful if you frequently switch between connection modes or multiple devices (and currently both bluetooth and wireless G work smoothly for me). I used a keyboard with a volume dial type feature before, and honestly feel it's unnecessary if you already have other appliances connected to your computer/laptop/etc where you can adjust the volume (or better yet just...lower the volume manually on the device itself).Reason I'm refraining from 5 stars is because I want to see how it holds out longevity wise. Also keep in mind this is a review by someone who isn't the most tech savvy or a keyboard modding pro (code for beginner friendly).
